intro: Parnassia submysorensis, commonly known as the Himalayan white crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at high elevations. Its leaves are palmately divided and have a distinctive bluish-green color. Parnassia submysorensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountain meadows and stream banks.
